title: partyland.io
author: partyland.io
content: WARNING ALERT FOR ğŸ¦ŠFOX BOUNTY SCAMSğŸ¦ŠSeems fox is scamming the hunters! And also the token ownersThey take the allocation that are in escrow and then they trade it to USDT and take it to their pocketproof for all chat with them is here and that they want ransom to work: https://imgur.com/a/esjYljLHow they do it? They say the Campaign is scam so all users donâ€™t think that they will get the tokens so how the scam work? 1. 2 weeks before they contact Â the token owner company they contact themwith fake newbie account ans ask for ransom of 4000 USDT or they will post lies. 2. once the token company refuse they post the lies3. 2 weeks later they offer a bounty service to the token company4. they ask for service fee of 500 USDT and also 20% of the bounty allocation to save in escrow and not use5. after the campagin start they "find" about the lies post with fake issues and then then suspend the bounty campaign and put text with scam notice. 6. then they contact the token company owners and ask for 8000 USDT Â to Â remove the scam tag and continue the work but now they ask for 8000-10,000 in USDT Â as ransom 7. then they say that they dont care about the hunters and they will take all the funds and make sure all go back to workSCAM SCAM SCAMFox sold the tokens and in the chat proof link attache you can see it. Then they ask for 8000 USDT and then 10,000 USDT in order to let hunters work again for them and in the end they will not pay to hunters. BEWARE OF THOSE FOX PEOPLE They play with the token owners and hunters and make ransoms and blackmails!!!!!!they took from token companu the 20% of total allocation in advancedThen he went to token traded exchanges in coinsbit and finexbox and they intentional tried to dropping the price and then he they scam tag on token owner...and then they contacted the token owner and asked for 8000 USDT (later it went up to 10,000 USDT) in order to remove the scam tag, let people work for them and also stop dropping the pricethey say that if the token owner will not pay the money they will drop the price of the token and by that they will harm the hunters and let all hunters blame the token company and not them. they also said to the token company owners - you havea lot of money so what is 8000 USDT Â for you? pay Â them and we will not destroy your campaign..... this is sad and they are truly scammers. they put this scam tag in order to blackmail us and he asked us in TG for 8000 USDT. we have proofs and we have attached them n the link attached. (https://imgur.com/a/esjYljL[/b][/color])BITCOIN TALK forum should be a safe place to explore and hire services. this guy post on us and then he took from us 7500 coins and then sold them in exchanges and put scam alert on Partyland just to ask us ransom of 8000 USDT and then he goes up to 10000 USDT. all proofs can be provided. also the scam post that he point to have contact us before and asked for 4000 USDT or he will post. those people called fox bounty campaigns are working together and doing scams and ransoms. please assistproof for all chat with them is here and that they want ransom to work: https://imgur.com/a/esjYljLThey did this in short:1. Put post on us with some newbie account 2. For no real reason scam tag the token owners3. Asked the token owners for 8000 and then 10,000 usdt to remove tag and return the campaigntheir account that we sent the pala toohttps://etherscan.io/tx/0x0b2d1915d81dc45531c9b611aee0fe29da8be8d84c6f1c0dff78bf09364d37fahttps://etherscan.io/tx/0xa3f2f9f6c31d6d4215e06e491dce557033b6e85735dadc7921125ecba6952187They asked us for 20% token to be escrows and they promise not to touch it. Then they went on coinsbit and just started selling like crazyaddress that hold the tokens: 0x2D0aeCC715e105BC223110387F73C35b04d3D2E6This is the address that was for escrow of the 6557 pala. They within few hours sent all to exchange name coinsbit and started selling all And close the campaign for no real reasonThey sold most of the pala and tried to drop the price Now they say that they will not remove the tag until we payThey sold pala for 1500 usdt +-They canâ€™t return the 7500They return 3800 pala3700 they sold for more then 1000 usdtSee the chat that I sent you for proofsAfter I â€œagreedâ€ to pay them 8000 usdt they return as they tougher that I will pay themIn the chat proofs I sent you you can see that they said that they just keep if for the community and will only sell 983 palaThey sold 3700Transaction of how much they returned:https://etherscan.io/tx/0x6c97f49f195519594b30987ab0847229e86293eff2cb11022bbf6405b3039632https://etherscan.io/tx/0xf4d0c4266b644e94355ea5387f2588c44c2a7e30732e95a8c223c764f8e83af8proof for all chat with them is here and that they want ransom to work: https://imgur.com/a/esjYljL

comments.body: You're the scammer Roee Ben Shushan, and you're now angry since you got exposed in all the bounty campaigns. So you're trying to report them. I'm starting a topic about your multiple scams, everything will be exposed. Everything will be proved. I will post things I didn't want to post before. On you and all the people who are supporting you and yours scams just because they got paid.I will take it further now cause you don't stop scamming and I want to protect people.To everyone here : Roee Ben Shushan is a well known and professional scammer behind a long list of scams, in and outside crypto. He is not at his first attempt with Partyland.All can be verified. I don't use editing software like he is claiming. All is trackable on the blockchain or in telegram.I will post the images here and will open a group in telegram where I will forward his messages so everyone can verify the source.Scam accusations topic coming soon...

comments.author: shasan
comments.body: I have gone through your post but I could not find out the profile who have scammed, and also could not see the reference link or something by which we can check. Would you like to post on a proper format so that users of the forum analyze easily and avoid them if they are really scammer. You can use this format.

comments.author: nliban
comments.body: Quote from: shasan on July 03, 2022, 07:00:49 AMI have gone through your post but I could not find out the profile who have scammed, and also could not see the reference link or something by which we can check. Would you like to post on a proper format so that users of the forum analyze easily and avoid them if they are really scammer. You can use this format.The author of this topic is a serial scammer. He did this topic to put the accusation on the bounty team who cancelled the bounty campaign after the scam accusation and who sold some of the tokens they received to cover their fees.I've made a scam accusation topic about the author if you need more details : https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5403696.0
